qas.question: What are the most abundant polyphenolics in purple grapes?
What is the main phenolic in white grapes?
What is the laboratory index of antioxidant strength in grapes known as?
What content of a grapes skin can be affected by soil composition, climate, and cultivation practices?
Why causes antioxidant strength to be higher in purple grapes?

context: <a0_0>Anthocyanins<a0_0/> tend to be the main polyphenolics in purple grapes whereas <a1_0>flavan-3-ols<a1_0/> (i.e. catechins) are the more abundant phenolic in white varieties. <a2_0>Total phenolic content<a2_0/>, a laboratory index of antioxidant strength, is higher in purple varieties due almost entirely to anthocyanin density in purple grape skin compared to absence of <a4_0>anthocyanins<a4_0/> in white grape skin. It is these anthocyanins that are attracting the efforts of scientists to define their properties for human health. <a3_0>Phenolic content<a3_0/> of grape skin varies with cultivar, soil composition, climate, geographic origin, and cultivation practices or exposure to diseases, such as fungal infections.
